SELECTION FOR CONSULTANTS BY THE WORLD BANK GROUP
REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST
Electronic Submissions through World Bank Group eConsultant2 https://wbgeconsult2.worldbank.org/wbgec/index.html
ASSIGNMENT OVERVIEW
Assignment Title: 1210431 - STC profiles required for Consumer/Vendor credit operations - Payments and Digital Finance Projects in EAP & South Asia.
Assignment Countries: - South East Asian Countries
ASSIGNMENT DESCRIPTION
The World Bank Group (WBG) provides support to public and private sector institutions to develop payments and related financial infrastructure. Within the context of support for financial sector development in selected South East Asian Countries, WBG aims to (i) improve access for factory workers, through employee benefit schemes, to consumer credit and other benefits and (ii) support development of short term inventory and distribution finance solutions for small retailers. The main objectives of these assignments are: (i) to assist a company in the design and implementation of a robust and responsible credit policy, risk management framework and operations for salary based consumer lending. The company will also be assisted in developing a strategy to transfer consumer lending to a credit institution. (ii) to assist consumer goods companies, distributors and financial institutions to put in place sustainable service through which to provide short term credit and loyalty solutions to small retailers
KEY TASKS OF ASSIGNMENTS: - Review a banks organisation and capabilities to identify fit with proposed lending operations and identify gaps/workplan - Assess high level investment, costs and skills required to develop and implement lending approach - Support bank staff with implementation (planning and operations) - Support bank in review of corporate partners process and business requirements - Support product and process design of the bank/service provider - Support development of an appropriate risk function, methodology and operations
The WBG is now looking for a pool of candidates who have relevant experience in the field to submit their CVs for potential projects below. - Support implementation of Distribution Chain Finance solution - Employee benefit scheme credit management review and operations design
FUNDING SOURCE
- To be advised
QUALIFICATION CRITERIA: * Areas of expertise: - Consumer or vendor finance operations: sales approach, origination, fulfillment processes, monitoring - Supply chain / working capital finance operations - Card based corporate lending - Credit assessments - Set-up and implementation of white label lending programs
* Product knowledge: - Working capital loans - Corporate purchase card - Invoice discounting - E-banking channels - Cash management - Point-of-sale consumer lending
* Business and users expertise: - Consumer finance and / or business credit - Vendor finance programs for export or trade
* Experience: - Minimum 10 years professional experience - BA in relevant field - Manager in operations of consumer or business credit - Retail distribution finance management within a retail/distribution company
* Skills: - B2B finance sales experience - Operations planning - Organisation and process design - Documentation - Training and supervision of staff and operations
* Countries exposure: - Middle income market experience (min 2 years) - Min 1 year experience in South East Asia - Based in Asia region
INDIVIDUAL / FIRM PROFILE The consultant should be an individual.
SUBMISSION REQUIREMENTS
The World Bank now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the services. Interested consultants must submit a letter of interest and a CV indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (description of similar assignments, experience in similar conditions, availability of appropriate skills, etc.). Please note that the total size of all attachments should be less than 5MB. Expressions of Interest and CVs should be submitted, in English, electronically through World Bank Group eConsultant2 (https://wbgeconsult2.worldbank.org/wbgec/index.html)
NOTES Selection and contracting will normally be made from responses to this notification. The consultant will be selected from a shortlist.
